tweet: This week marks #HolocaustRemembrance Week. My father is a survivor of the Holocaust, and I know this week means a lot to him, my family, and many around the world. We remember those we lost, and we stand up to antisemitism, racism, and all forms of bigotry. pic.twitter.com/2FnK3SbGHP

Our Commonwealth is taking the necessary steps to combat #ClimateChange. Congress must do the same and pass the #ClimateActionNow Act with my amendment that encourages us to go above and beyond the Paris Agreement and work with countries around the world to fight climate change. https://twitter.com/GovernorTomWolf/status/1123255693576773632 …

No one should have to forego lifesaving screenings or any preventative treatments because of insufficient health care or finances. 

To Lori Smith, her husband Kenny, and all my fellow Americans battling cancer: I will not stop fighting for you.

I refuse to let Lori's death and the thousands of cancer-related deaths go unnoticed. I cosponsored the bipartisan, life-saving Colorectal Cancer Screening Act, which would waive Medicare's cost-sharing requirement for preventative screening colonoscopies.

I spoke on the House Floor today to honor Lori Smith, a member of our #PA06 community who passed away last month after a long and hard-fought battle with stage IV colorectal cancer. pic.twitter.com/4Fc9kopHG9

This BIPARTISAN bill will:
✅expand background checks
✅reduce firearms trafficking by prohibiting unlicensed transfers through unregulated secondary sales.
✅aid law enforcement’s ability to trace crime guns, which depends on licensed gun dealers’ sales records

The Senate must do its duty to the people and pass H.R. 8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act of 2019. When we say "Enough is enough," we mean it. https://www.dailylocal.com/news/local/houlahan-urges-senate-to-act-on-gun-violence-prevention-during/article_6eee4224-6aa0-11e9-bb9a-3737ae5b671d.html …

It is time the Senate does its duty and takes action on #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act of 2019, which I cosponsored and helped pass in the House. We in Congress must do our part to end this gun violence epidemic by enacting common sense gun reform now. 3/3 pic.twitter.com/E4dyiVx7Sw

The United States and its Administration must re-enter the Paris Agreement, but the work and effort cannot stop there. My amendment would encourage our country to do more to address this global crisis that affects our environment, economy, health, and national security.

Wishing all Pennsylvanians who celebrate a #HappyEaster. 

May we keep in our hearts today the people of Sri Lanka and the families of all those who have lost lives or have been injured today in this senseless violence. We stand with you. https://twitter.com/PennsylvaniaGov/status/1119948900964503552 …

We live in a world where, too often, we awake to horrific news of violent attacks. My heart is broken for the people of Sri Lanka this Easter morning. We must work to end senseless violence and terrorism; we stand with the people of Sri Lanka.

It’s been 20 years since the shooting at #Columbine High School. We must continue to fight for and honor those we’ve lost by standing up to #EndGunViolence. When we say #Neveragain, we need to mean it and pass legislation that works to prevent senseless gun violence.

We will never forget

I intend to uphold this mantle through legislation, oversight, and appropriation that protects the democracy and stands up for the people of Pennsylvania.  4/4

What is also clear is that the behavior from the Oval Office and this Administration disrespected the rule of law and our values as a country during this investigation. Pennsylvanians sent me to Washington in part to restore civility to and faith in our democracy. 3/

What is clear is that a foreign government actively sought to influence our country’s election. I urge the Administration to work transparently with Congress to prevent this kind of attack on our electoral processes from happening again. 2/

After taking time to go through the redacted report, I feel we are left with more questions than with answers. To arrive at informed answers, the American people and Congress need access to the full report and underlying evidence. 1/

I introduced this bill b/c I understand that success of small businesses translates into success for our country. Accelerated payments from the federal government is an important step in addressing the needs of the many Americans who run/are employed by small businesses. 3/3

In our community, #PA06, over 99% of the firms are considered small businesses. The bill would direct federal government agencies that contract with small businesses, which comprise 99.7% of all firms w/ paid employees in America, to pay those small businesses within 15 days. 2/

I am standing up for local and small businesses by introducing the Accelerated Payments for Small Business Act as the Lead Democrat. Small businesses in PA, and across the country, represent a critical component to our national economic wellbeing.  1/

We have passed the Bipartisan Background Checks Act of 2019, an important first step in ensuring such a tragedy doesn't happen again. We must continue to do the work to honor the countless lives lost to the gun violence epidemic.

12 years ago, we lost 32 young people to an act of senseless gun violence. 

We remember them. 
We honor them. 
We fight for their memory and for their families with action.

We in Congress must enact effective gun control legislation that will curb gun violence.

Q - What can Congress do to encourage investment in #ComputerScience education? 

A - With respect to #CyberSecurity, we need to make sure there are people in the pipeline ready to confront these issues. Computer science is an education issue and a national security issue.

20/

A - No. Next question.

...technology, more judges, more social workers, and other elements. We need to work with people from both sides of the aisle to address the southern border in a way that secures our borders and upholds our values as a nation.

Q - What are you doing about the southern border? 

A- I’m the daughter of a refugee. I honor the ability of someone coming here to seek asylum and as a refugee. Congress needs to look at the southern border holistically. I am for effective border security that involves...

17/

Q - Do you represent the people of your community or the party?

A - I represent the people of our community, today and always. Even when we don’t agree, I am here to stand for up for and elevate the voices of those in #PA06. 

16/

Q - Your thoughts on free speech in schools and college campuses? 

A - We need to protect the right to free speech in schools, on campuses, and everywhere in our country. We may not agree, but we must work to respect others’ opinions. 

15/

Q - What is your opinion on school choice?

A - I am a strong believer in our public schools. I believe the first line of defense should be strong support of public schools and public educators. 

14/

We lose too many of our veterans to suicide, and Congress must do its part to support those who have bravely served. I am proud to lead this effort to urge the Army and Navy to fully implement the VA’s Women’s Health Transition Assistance program pilot. 3/ https://www.npr.org/2018/05/29/614011243/battling-depression-and-suicide-among-female-veterans …

The program's mission is to inform women transitioning out of active duty service of the VA’s services, including gender-specific care. As a veteran, I understand the unique challenges our servicewomen face when transitioning to civilian life after serving our country. 2/

With threats like C. auris, we must be proactive in our research and preventative actions. I am standing up for the people of #PA06 and all Americans when I urge Congress to continue fully supporting the important work of the NIAID. 9/9

The #TrumpBudget has proposed $768 million in cuts to the NIAID, which would amount to an overall 13.9% reduction. This cut would greatly hamper NIAID's ability to pursue research critical to our nation's health, growth, and prosperity. 8/

With threats like C. auris, we must be proactive in our research and preventative actions. I am standing up for the people of #PA06 and all Americans when I urge Congress to continue fully supporting the important work of the NIAID. 9/9

The NIAID conducts/supports research to better understand, treat, and ultimately prevent infectious, immunologic, and allergic diseases. The scientist at NIAID are the people working to safeguard our country from the spread of disease and potential pandemics. 7/

I led a letter, signed by @RepCasten and @CongressmanJVD (also scientists), urging the @AppropsDems to continue fully funding the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (@NIAIDNews) at the @NIH.  6/ pic.twitter.com/DggrTjeFPW

There have already been 587 reported cases of people contracting C. auris in the United States. Science should never be a partisan issue. Protecting Americans should never be a partisan issue. We must act. 5/ pic.twitter.com/lvgue3YPCy

This is a global issue. This is an American issue. "More recent estimates from researchers at @WUSTLmed put the death toll" for Americans who've contracted resistant infections at 162,000. The @CDCgov says "nearly half of patients who contract C. auris die within 90 days." 4/

A study conducted by the British government projects that, unless we take action now, "10 million people could die worldwide of all such infections in 2050, eclipsing the eight million expected to die that year from cancer." 3/

C. auris is part of a "rise of drug-resistant infections" across the globe. Already, experts have said that "unless more effective new medicines are developed and unnecessary use of antimicrobial drugs is sharply curbed, risk will spread to healthier populations." 2/ pic.twitter.com/YwflG6fzk8

"The germ, a fungus called Candida auris, preys on people w/ weakened immune systems, and it is quietly spreading across the globe." 

It has recently reached NY, NJ, and IL. CDC has classified it as an "urgent threat." 

We need to talk about this. 1/. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/06/health/drug-resistant-candida-auris.html?smid=nytcore-ios-share …

Elevating women is not a women's issue. 

🌎It is an economics issue 
🌎It is a national security issue 
🌎It is a human rights issue.

The world advances when women are empowered. I am proud to be part of this historic class of women in Congress. 
Our work is just beginning. 7/7

When gender equality is prioritized, there is a lower propensity for conflict both domestically and abroad. 5/ pic.twitter.com/zyAl0a7et5
